verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: No significant differences; literal rendering of the Hebrew introduction.

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel and say to them: When you enter the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you as an inheritance, the land of Canaan as defined by its boundaries),
verses.comment: "Shall fall to you" reflects 'will be allotted to you' or 'shall be your inheritance.'

verses.text: your southern side shall be from the Wilderness of Zin alongside Edom, and your southern border shall begin at the end of the Salt Sea on the east.
verses.comment: "Salt Sea" is the Dead Sea; "Wilderness of Zin" and Edom are places bordering Israel.

verses.text: Your border shall turn south of the ascent of Akrabbim, cross to Zin, and its end shall be south of Kadesh-barnea. Then it shall go to Hazar-addar and pass along to Azmon.
verses.comment: "Ascent of Akrabbim" is a pass; the route is geographical, so names are transliterated.

verses.text: The border shall turn from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and its end shall be at the sea.
verses.comment: "Brook of Egypt" likely means Wadi El-Arish; "the sea" refers to the Mediterranean.

verses.text: For the western border, you shall have the Great Sea as a border. This shall be your western border.
verses.comment: "Great Sea" is the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.text: And this shall be your northern border: From the Great Sea you shall mark out your line to Mount Hor.
verses.comment: A different Mount Hor than in Num. 20:22; here, north Canaan, not Edom.

verses.text: From Mount Hor you shall draw a line to the entrance of Hamath, and the border shall go out to Zedad.
verses.comment: "Entrance of Hamath" means its southern approach.

verses.text: Then the border shall go to Ziphron, and its end shall be at Hazar-enan. This shall be your northern border.
verses.comment: Names are kept as in original. Locations are uncertain.

verses.text: You shall mark out your eastern border from Hazar-enan to Shepham.
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: The border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain. Then the border shall descend and reach the shoulder of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east.
verses.comment: "Sea of Chinnereth" is the Sea of Galilee; "shoulder" means edge.

verses.text: The border shall go down to the Jordan, and its end shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land with its boundaries all around.”
verses.comment: "Salt Sea" again is the Dead Sea.

verses.text: Moses commanded the people of Israel, saying, “This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which the LORD has commanded to give to the nine and a half tribes.
verses.comment: "By lot" means by lotcasting; nine and a half tribes after the Transjordan.

verses.text: For the tribe of the sons of Reuben by their fathers' houses, and the tribe of the sons of Gad by their fathers' houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
verses.comment: "Fathers’ houses" reflects the Hebrew ‘bet-avot’, showing family division.

verses.text: The two and a half tribes have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan east of Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
verses.comment: ‘Toward the sunrise’ is literal for ‘toward the east’.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Standard formula; literal.

verses.text: “These are the names of the men who shall divide the land for you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.comment: Literal, with proper names in standard form.

verses.text: You shall also take one leader from each tribe to divide the land for inheritance.
verses.comment: "Leader" used for Hebrew 'nasi'.

verses.text: These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Simeon: Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
verses.comment: Literal with family phrase ('sons of Simeon')

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; names as in Hebrew.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Dan a leader: Bukki the son of Jogli.
verses.comment: "Leader" supplied for clarity; same word as v18.

verses.text: Of the sons of Joseph, of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh: Hanniel the son of Ephod.
verses.comment: Names and 'sons of Joseph' reflect original structure.

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim: Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.
verses.comment: Literal, no additions.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun: Elizaphan the son of Parnach.
verses.comment: Literal.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Issachar: Paltiel the son of Azzan.
verses.comment: Literal.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Asher: Ahihud the son of Shelomi.
verses.comment: Literal.

verses.text: Of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali: Pedahel the son of Ammihud.
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: These are the men whom the LORD commanded to apportion the inheritance for the people of Israel in the land of Canaan.
verses.comment: No significant differences. Faithful to original.
